newsitem.title: UK: RESEARCH ALERT - Kleinwort downgrades Ciadea.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Kleinwort downgrades Ciadea.

text.p: Kleinwort Benson said on Tuesday it had downgraded Argentine auto manufacturer Ciadea to "long term buy" from "buy" amid fierce competition and a milder than expected recovery in the country's auto sector.

"We rate Ciadea a buy strictly on a long term view," Latin America manufacturing sector analyst Carl Weaver said in a note to investors. Kleinwort has had the stock on a straight "buy" recommendation for the last six months. "The expected return to the good old days has not materialised this year," Weaver said.

"Fiercer competition, stagnant prices and heavy capex will dictate auto trends in the short term. Coming off a weak base, 1997 earnings per share growth of 200 percent is already factored in," he added.

A potential slowdown in consumption following the firing of Argentine economy minister Domingo Cavallo three months ago also weighed in Kleinwort Benson's decision to downgrade its recommendation, Weaver said.

Ciadea is a local manufacturer of Renault SA cars. Weaver said the firm's efforts to tap into the Mercosur market would come at a high price, requiring high cash outlays to tempt buyers with new models.

"However, in the long run, Ciadea through its Clio and expected new launches, should be a winner in the compact and medium range market," he said, while Renault's Brazilian operations should grant Ciadea access to Latin America's biggest market.
Ordinary Ciadea shares closed on Monday at 4.380 pesos a share on the Buenos Aires exchange.
